function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Economic impacts on public and private sports organizations","category":"Business","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of detailed poe studies for health club facilities","category":"Organizations","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Global lack of access to vaccines","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Decrease in cancer diagnoses due to pandemic","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Missed regular vaccinations for other infectious diseases during lockdown","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Racial minorities at higher risk of infection","category":"Person","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Socioeconomically deprived populations vulnerable to nphis targeting covid-19","category":"Person","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration of publication bias may lead to overestimation or underestimation of treatment effects.","category":"Leadership","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"A sense of loss evoked when designs change negatively or are demolished","category":"Person","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Focus on human contact with natural systems and processes in the built environment could lead to the spread of contagious diseases through exposure to natural elements.","category":"Participation","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The theory of biophilia and the instinctive human need for contact with nature may lead to a greater likelihood of exposure to infectious agents present in natural elements.","category":"Participation","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contagious diseases transmission in built environment due to close interactions and shared spaces.","category":"Person","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of awareness and understanding of biophilic design principles leading to improper implementation and maintenance of natural elements.","category":"Organizations","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Criticism of 'green-washing' or 'placebo' strategies related to nature in architecture","category":"Organizations","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Biophilia leading to close contact with infectious organisms or vectors","category":"Participation","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Concealment of lack of real improvements or effectiveness in 'greening' of architecture","category":"Organizations","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Proximity to water source in construction","category":"Business","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Literal greening used as a marketing tool may create false expectations and limited impact on social, economic, and environmental challenges.","category":"Business","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration of disease transmission in natural design elements could pose a risk to public health in built environments.","category":"Organizations","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Shortages of essential medical resources, including sars-cov-2 testing kits, ventilators, and personal protective equipment","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of preparation for future pandemics","category":"Leadership","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate funding for scientific research during pandemics","category":"Leadership","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Study limitations on small to medium-sized medical equipment for covid-19","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High infection rate caused by close contact between health care workers and patients","category":"Person","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of medical robotics in treatment process","category":"Organizations","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Application of other types of robotics in hospitals for various tasks","category":"Organizations","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Robotic technologies for pandemic response are expensive and have long development times, limiting their adoption for covid-19 applications.","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shortage of opioid medications and lack of palliative care training for primary caregivers and health care professionals in emergency departments and intensive care units.","category":"Organizations","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High infection rate of health care workers leading to a shortage of health care workers.","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Long-term reliance on ppe, especially face masks, may lead to complacency and reduced compliance over time, increasing the risk of disease spread","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient testing and approval of medical inventions for disease prevention may lead to ineffective or unsafe products being used in the market","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shortage of medical equipment like masks and ventilators due to high labor dependency and crowded working environment","category":"Business","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Challenges in using 3d printers for producing medical equipment due to cost and efficiency issues","category":"Business","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High infection risks in labor-intensive industries like food processing and delivery","category":"Business","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased demand for ventilators","category":"Business","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate testing volume","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential inconvenience and expense of daily mask cleaning and filter replacement","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High cost and unavailability of airpop masks for android users","category":"Business","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Conceptual nature of yanko design’s smart display face shield","category":"Organizations","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inconvenience and noise of purifying shield","category":"Organizations","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Cost-effectiveness of additive manufacturing technologies using fff, up to a certain production volume, may lead to limited availability of ppe.","category":"Business","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Global reliance on 3d-printed ppe leading to supply chain vulnerabilities and disruptions","category":"Business","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of testing kits","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shortages of ventilators","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ethical concerns related to capturing occupant information through sensors and cameras","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Uncertainty in handling laundry and waste disposal in hotels and other public facilities during a pandemic","category":"Business","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of evidence to assess the acceptability and feasibility of iaq interventions to key stakeholders.","category":"Organizations","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Complexity of evaluating the risk of sars-cov-2 infection in indoor environments","category":"Business","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Routine disinfection timeframes not being followed for contacted surfaces and items","category":"Organizations","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of systematic guidance for drainage system operation and maintenance for infection control","category":"Participation","confidence":"Medium"}]}
